ygData.subject: Re: Freeport Cleric Quest
ygData.msgSnippet: Sounds good to me if someone s nose is so far up in the air that they can t stand a little bit of grammacal errors then take your mouse and delete all my
ygData.messageBody:
Sounds good to me if someone's nose is so far up in the air that they
can't stand a little bit of grammacal errors then take your mouse and delete
all my messages because I write these in about 30secs because my life is not
the computer and correcting my Mailing list E-Mails or what have you is on
the very bottom of my TO DO list. Like iI said before this is not a English
class as long as messages are readable then get over it. TALK ABOUT EQ NOT
GRAMMER SKILLS
-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... <sarah@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, July 23, 1999 11:30 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Freeport Cleric Quest


>From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
>This is not an English class, but it is not a message board either. This is
>a mailing list.
>
>A mailing list is used to communicate between people. Every time you
>communicate in writing, you are going to be judged based on the
>quality of your writing, including following proper grammatical,
>punctuation, and spelling rules for the language you are corresponding
>in.
>
>I tend to give people more slack on the Internet, since often these
messages
>are written rapidly and sent off without going back to proofread what
>was written. However, there comes a point that your message is obscured
>by the lack of these things.
>
>I believe what this fellow was saying is, because of your lack of
punctuation,
>not following basic grammatical rules, and your total disregard for
>spelling, your mail was approaching the point that the message you
>were trying to communicate was obscured by the poor technical execution.
>
>Feel free, of course, to continue to write in run-on sentences, ignore
>spelling, and use improper punctuation. But in the process be aware there
>are those who will not finish reading your message, and thus
>will not receive your communication because they will hit <delete>
>and continue on in the mail spool.
>
>Sarah Heacock
>
>On Fri, 23 Jul 1999, The Scotts wrote:
>
>> From: "The Scotts" <jtscott@...>
>>
>> Jeez what happened did this board turn into a English class or
>> something so what my typing skills suck who really gives a damn everyone
can
>> read it. Proofread no its just a message board Not an English class a
>> message board Get it?. got it...Thank you
